item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The outbreak at the [Cañon City] prison has become the state prison system’s second-largest on record, infecting 356 inmates and 24 workers, data shows."

A 58-year-old inmate at the Fremont Correctional Facility near Cañon City has died, officials said Thursday, amid a widening coronavirus outbreak at the prison.

gazette.com

Inmate at Fremont County Prison dies amid widening COVID outbreak

A 58-year-old inmate at the Fremont Correctional Facility near Cañon City has died, officials said Thursday, amid a widening coronavirus outbreak at the prison.A 58-year-old inmate at the Fremont Correctional Facility near Cañon City has died, officials said Thursday, amid a widening coronavirus outbreak at the prison.

item.title: "Escupo y sale sangre". Inmigrantes en el Centro de...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Escupo y sale sangre".

Inmigrantes en el Centro de Detención GEO en Aurora, Colorado denuncian que las instalaciones son desinfectadas con un químico muy fuerte y sin ventilación. Esto les genera desde náuseas hasta sangrados de nariz y/o boca. Mientras tanto el número de contagiados con el COVID-19 va en aumento.

item.title: "Twelve flights to Haiti have been recorded so far in...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Twelve flights to Haiti have been recorded so far in October by the watchdog group Witness at the Border (formerly Witness: Tornillo) (https://www.witnessattheborder.org/),
marking a steep increase from previous months when there were on average between one and two flights every four weeks."

Another piece is out today in The Guardian, shining a light on the heartlessness of ICE Air deportations reporting on the rapid increase in flights to Haiti that Witness at the Border has been highlighting in their weekly reports."

The Trump administration is justifying the expulsions under a public health law but critics say they risk spreading coronavirus in the Caribbean nation

theguardian.com

US steps up deportation of Haitians ahead of election, raising Covid fears

The Trump administration is justifying the expulsions under a public health law but critics say they risk spreading coronavirus in the Caribbean nationThe Trump administration is justifying the expulsions under a public health law but critics say they risk spreading coronavirus in the Caribbean nation

item.title: When we talk about the abolition of police, prisons and the...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

When we talk about the abolition of police, prisons and the military were are also talking about funding healthcare, housing, refugee resettlement and social programs *instead of* these violent systems of authority.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: The Democrats are spineless.
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

The Democrats are spineless.

Diana C. Brown

Here's a list of 19 different ways the Democrats could have delayed ACB's confirmation, according to a memo circulated on Capitol Hill and reprinted in the Inte...rcept, Common Dreams, and other outlets:

Exercising Rights To Delay Senate Action Generally

Speaking at Length — In the absence of a unanimous consent agreement governing time to debate or cloture, a Senator who gets recognized to speak can speak at length.

Objecting to Routine Consent Agreements — Any Senator may object to routine unanimous consent agreements, such as those to adjourn, to recess, to approve the Journal, or to dispense with the Morning Hour. Forcing roll-call votes on routine motions to adjourn or recess would require Senators to come to the Capitol and also prevent the Senate from taking other action during the time that it would take for Senators to come to vote.

New Legislative Day — If the Senate adjourns without a unanimous consent agreement providing for the handling of routine business at the beginning of a new legislative day, a new legislative day starts with the morning hour, a 2-hour period with a number of required procedures. As part of the morning hour, any Senator could make a non-debatable motion to proceed to an item on the Senate calendar.

Objecting to Lifting Quorum Calls — Any Senator can object to unanimous consent to lifting a quorum call, forcing a recorded vote that would require Senators to come to the Capitol and also prevent the Senate from taking other action during the time it takes for Senators to come to vote.

Motions to Adjourn and Recess — Any Senator can move to adjourn, to adjourn to a day certain, or to take a recess. All of these motions take precedence over a motion to proceed to the consideration of a nomination. Senators could make a series of motions of this sort to force roll-call votes.

Layover Requirements — Senators can raise points of order if measures have not lain over sufficiently under Rule XIV or XVII.

Raising Points of Order — Any Senator who gets recognized by the Presiding Officer can raise a point of order making a procedural objection. Once the Presiding Officer rules, a Senator can appeal the ruling of the Chair, and Senators can demand a roll-call vote. One could imagine an extremely large number of procedural questions on which to vote.

Filing Cloture — If the Senate is not governed by a unanimous consent agreement or post cloture, a Senator who got recognized could move to proceed to a measure or series of measures and file cloture on the motion(s) to proceed. Two days later, the Senate would be required to vote on the cloture motion(s). The number of these motions is limited only by the number of items on the calendar.

Fast-Track Vehicles — Several fast-track statutes, including the Congressional Budget Act, the Congressional Review Act, the War Powers Act, and the Arms Export Control Act, give any Senator the right to move to proceed to a vehicle and force a roll-call vote and sometimes a period of debate. For example, any Senator could submit a concurrent resolution on the budget, and by precedent, if action has not yet been taken on a budget resolution for the coming fiscal year, then the resolution would be immediately placed on the calendar. Once on the calendar, any Senator could move to proceed to the resolution, forcing a roll-call vote on the motion to proceed. Meanwhile, resolutions of disapproval under the CRA can be petitioned out of committee with 30 signatures after 20 calendar days. Such measures could be filed en masse now.

Utilizing Rule XIV — Any Senator can have any legislative measure placed on the calendar in two legislative days under Rule XIV. Leader Schumer could ask every Democratic Senator to introduce bills on their favorite subjects en masse and seek to put them on the calendar via rule XIV. Once they were on the calendar two legislative days later, if Schumer could get the floor, he could move to proceed to each in turn, file cloture, withdraw his motion to proceed, move to another, file cloture, withdraw his motion to proceed, and continue to repeat, stacking up an almost endless series of votes on motions to invoke cloture on motions to proceed to Democratic priorities, until the Majority Leader shut the Senate down.

To prevent this strategy, the Majority Leader would have to keep the Senate locked down post cloture at all times and prevent the Democratic Leader from getting recognition, or continue to recess the Senate to prevent there ever being another legislative day. If the Majority Leader did the latter, the Democratic leader could still file serial motions to proceed to bills already on the calendar, so long as he could gain recognition to make the motions. This strategy requires there being an opportunity for motions to be made.

House Measures Requiring Senate Action

Impeachment — If the House of Representatives exercised its impeachment power, then the rules of the Senate require the Senate to immediately address that matter.

Amendments Between Houses — If the House of Representatives passed amendments to Senate-passed bills now pending in the House and sent those over to the Senate, those messages between Houses would be privileged in the Senate. Thus, in the absence of cloture or a unanimous consent agreement governing the Senate floor, a Senator could ask that such a message be laid before the Senate and make motions in connection with the message that would require immediate roll-call votes or offer a motion to concur (or concur with an amendment) and file cloture, once again forcing a roll-call vote after two days.

Short-Term Funding — The House of Representatives could insist on very short-term funding measures until the Leadership of both Houses came to agreement on proceedings for the balance of the year. Short-term funding measures would then require more-frequent roll-call votes.

War Powers Resolutions — Generally, within a certain number of days, the Senate has to take up WPRs or any Senator can move to proceed.

There are likely additional measures available that, if passed by the House, would demand action in the Senate.

Exercising Rights in the Judiciary Committee

Time for Review and Hearing — The Judiciary Committee customarily takes time to review the record of Supreme Court nominees. Democrats should demand that the Committee take this time before a hearing commences.

Objecting to Committees Meeting — Any Senator can object to unanimous consent for committees to meet more than two hours after the Senate convenes on a day in which the Senate is in session.

Full Hearings — Democratic Members of the Judiciary Committee could try to continue the proceedings of any hearing that the Chairman calls.

Hold Over Committee Action — Under Judiciary Committee rule I, paragraph 3, “At the request of any member . . . a . . . nomination on the agenda of the Committee may be held over until the next meeting of the Committee or for one week, whichever occurs later.” A Democratic Senator on the Judiciary Committee should demand that the nomination be held over for the week.

Denying a Quorum — Republicans need to produce the presence of a quorum of Judiciary Committee Senators to report out the nomination. Democrats might choose not to help produce the necessary Senators.

They didn't.

See More

item.title: Chileans voted overwhelmingly to throw out the country's...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Chileans voted overwhelmingly to throw out the country's Pinochet-era constitution and form a new one. More than 7.5 million people voted, setting a new record for participation, officials said.

One year after Santiago's streets were jammed by protesters, they were filled Sunday with revelers. More than 7.5 million people voted, setting a new record for voter participation, officials said.

npr.org

Chile Celebrates Voters' Decision To Scrap Constitution, Start Over

One year after Santiago's streets were jammed by protesters, they were filled Sunday with revelers. More than 7.5 million people voted, setting a new record for voter participation, officials said.One year after Santiago's streets were jammed by protesters, they were filled Sunday with revelers. More than 7.5 million people voted, setting a new record for voter participation, officials said.

item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Advocates with the Colorado People's Alliance, the group that organized the press conference, are now pushing local ICE officials to continue releasing detainees on humanitarian parole.

Immigration attorneys have also pushed for bond hearings and, in some cases, filed lawsuits to get their clients out of the facility. Some of those lawsuits led to detainees being released, while others were dismissed by judges in the U.S. District Court of Colorado."

A total of 110 Aurora ICE detainees have tested positive.

item.title: Join us Friday, October 30 for a virtual protest against the...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Join us Friday, October 30 for a virtual protest against the scariest company on earth, Palantir Technologies! This horrifying corporation provides the technology that ICE uses to detain and deport immigrants and destroy families and communities. In August they had the audacity to relocate to Denver and are now spreading their evil-dead terror in our own state. The fear this company spreads is the REAL DEAL. It cannot be allowed to get away with it! We will hold a Halloween t...hemed virtual protest with live theatre and digital actions against Palantir to demonstrate the real monster this Halloween.

**Due to the rising rates of COVID in Colorado, we invite you to join our livestream virtually as we perform street theatre and take action digitally! More to come soon!**

**********

¡Únase a nosotros el viernes 30 de octubre para una protesta virtual en la empresa más aterradora del mundo, Palantir Technologies! Esta corporación horrible proporciona la tecnología que usa ICE para detener y deportar inmigrantes y destruir familias y comunidades. En agosto, tuvieron la audacia de trasladarse a Denver y ahora están esparciendo su terror de muerte maligna en nuestro propio estado. El miedo que transmite esta empresa es el TRATO REAL. ¡No se puede permitir que se salga con la suya! Realizaremos una protesta virtual temática de Halloween con teatro en vivo y acciones digitales contra Palantir para demostrar el monstruo real este Halloween.

**Debido a las crecientes tasas de COVID en Colorado, les invitamos a unirse a nuestra transmisión en vivo virtualmente mientras realizamos teatro callejero y actuamos digitalmente. ¡Más por venir pronto!**

See More

FRI, OCT 30 AT 5:30 PM MDT

The Terror From Palantir: Halloween Virtual Protest Against The Scariest Company on Earth

item.title: Join community tomorrow for a press conference with Chris' friends and family....
item.content:encoded:
Join community tomorrow for a press conference with Chris' friends and family.

A BLM protestor was ran over on their scooter this summer wearing a BLM mask in Denver and many in community feel that it's a major DPD coverup.

Chris was wearing a BLM mask, he tried to get his friends out of harms way and the driver redirected and targeted him, plowing into a group of black kids and killing Chris. All the kids are from out of town and coming back for the DPD press conference Tuesday

Tomorrow we expect police to say they found the car but no driver and DPD may even be closing the investigation b/c the car was supposedly reported stolen before the incident.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Gaby and Lupe are selling cebiche & Spring Fling Cake this weekend. They’re raising money to pay for legal fees for...
item.content:encoded: Gaby and Lupe are selling cebiche & Spring Fling Cake this weekend. They’re raising money to pay for legal fees for family members, and legal fees are incredibly high. Buy a meal and #KeepFamiliesTogether this weekend. tinyurl.com/solidaritymeals-10-17
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Via @coloradopeoplesalliance and the Detention Lifeline...
item.content:encoded:
Via @coloradopeoplesalliance and the Detention Lifeline

🚨Community Alert🚨
The Aurora Fire Chief notified council members of a COVID-19 outbreak at the GEO detention facility this afternoon. There are 19 confirmed positive cases! We know we can't count on GEO to keep our community members who are detained safe. We demand that GEO releases as many folks as possible on humanitarian parole and ensures that those who are sick receive the proper medical care! We will keep monitoring the situation and connect with folks inside the facility to ensure their health and safety.

Read our full press release here: https://coloradopeoplesalliance.ourpowerbase.net/civicrm/mailing/view?id=1271&reset=1

🚨Alerta a la comunidad🚨
El jefe de bomberos de Aurora notificó a los miembros del consejo sobre un brote de COVID-19 en el centro de detención de GEO en Aurora esta tarde. ¡Hay 19 casos positivos confirmados! Sabemos que no podemos contar con GEO para mantener seguros a los miembros de nuestra comunidad que están detenidos. Exigimos que GEO libere a la mayor cantidad posible de personas en libertad condicional humanitaria y garantice que los enfermos reciban la atención médica adecuada. Seguiremos al tanto de la situación y nos conectaremos con las personas dentro de las instalaciones para garantizar su salud y seguridad.

Lea nuestro comunicado de prensa completo aquí: https://coloradopeoplesalliance.ourpowerbase.net/civicrm/mailing/view?id=1271&reset=1
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "Community showed up on Tuesday afternoon in LoDo to make sure Palantir Tech feels unwelcome in Denver....
item.content:encoded:
"Community showed up on Tuesday afternoon in LoDo to make sure Palantir Tech feels unwelcome in Denver.

Palantir Technologies is ICE’s technology backbone, provides the digital infrastructure to surveil, detain and deport immigrants."

Photos by @buffalo_heart_images
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with...
item.content:encoded: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with difficulties accessing medication and sanitary products, serious COVID risks, abuse from guards, and intense stress from isolation (23+ hours a day). Their civil rights are also being violated with Denver, Adams and Arapahoe County working together to deny our comrades a bond hearing. Our comrades suffer yet they are still thinking of others — constantly telling communjty about the conditions of their cell mates and others in the jail and agitating for their release as well. @justiceforelijahmcclain PSL Denver and Say Their Names 5280 are heroes and freedom fighters. And we need to be fighting harder than ever for them. See you Saturday!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: After the success of last year's "Confront la Migra Where They Live!" house demonstration in the suburban neighborhood...
item.content:encoded:
After the success of last year's "Confront la Migra Where They Live!" house demonstration in the suburban neighborhood of GEO Warden Johnny Choate, @auroragov and APD spent nearly a QUARTER OF A MILLION dollars to police the Enough Coalition march up Colfax to GEO in the following week. In a SINGLE DAY A quarter million dollars were paid out to APD and Adams County officers just to try to intimidate us with fences and riot gear. That day, APD also tried to make our indigenous comrades drop their prayer sticks to enter on Oakland Street and when our comrades told APD, "You're in riot gear and have batons! Let us have our prayer sticks or we are gonna sue the shit out of you!"

Why does APD continue to do private security for Aurora GEO? La policia, la migra, misma porqueria!

Photos by @denvercommunists

#AbolishICE #ChingaLaMigra #closethecamps
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Date: Sunday, September 20th, 2020 from 1-3PM @ Aurora GEO 3130 Oakland St...
item.content:encoded:
Date: Sunday, September 20th, 2020 from 1-3PM @ Aurora GEO 3130 Oakland St

*Please adhere to 6ft social distancing - Wear your masks, bring your hand sanitizer.*

"We'll be highlighting the refugee and immigrant experience of our AAPI communities. We want to peacefully express our concerns about the new ICE Director appointment. Please join us in solidarity!

Asian refugee and immigrant speakers from Chinese, Vietnamese, And Korean backgrounds will provide their powerful stories and perspectives. Immigration advocates and activists will also provide updates on current issues surrounding immigration.

We invite you to sign postcards to express your support for ICE detainees that will be delivered to local legislators.

Please share this event and encourage others to show up and support!"
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Message us for the event link! This series is every Tuesday in person or online until Sept 29!...
item.content:encoded:
Message us for the event link! This series is every Tuesday in person or online until Sept 29!

https://facebook.com/events/s/immigration-is-an-lgbtq-issue-/269755914013547/?ti=cl

Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders
TUESDAYS @ 6:30pm • Sept. 8, 15*, 22 & 29

(This event is NOT being held at the Althea Center.)

ONLINE via Zoom to Facebook Live
• Sept. 15*: Only available online on this date.
• Recordings of the series will be posted on YouTube.
OR
ON-SITE (Raíces Brewing, 2060 West Colfax Ave.)
• In-person reservations REQUIRED & limited to first 50 people.

Drinks & Pizza at Raíces Brewing Company starting @ 5:30PM (Reservations required for Raíces)

Zoom Program and live streaming @ 6:30PM

Entertainment produced by Black Actors Guild @ 7:30-8:00PM

Registration: FREE 4-week series!
Please register in advance.
Raíces reservation and program Zoom information emailed with RSVP confirmation.
Immigration Equality shoulder bag for the first 100 registrants.

https://www.altheacenter.org/loveacrossborders

Mariposa at the Althea Center, in partnership with NY-based Immigration Equality and American Friends Service Committee Colorado, will present “Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders,” 4-week series of programs highlighting some of the traumatizing circumstances and critical needs of our LGBTQ sisters and brothers seeking asylum in the United States.

With simultaneous Spanish/English interpretation provided for Zoom participants, we will hear powerful and personal migration stories from current and recent LGBTQ asylum seekers. PFLAG Las Cruces, NM, will share their “real life” model of hosting asylum seekers, for which they won an award last year from the national PFLAG organization. We will hear from national and local leaders doing the day-to-day work of assisting and supporting these asylum seekers.

Registration: FREE 4-week series!
Please register in advance.
Raíces reservation and program Zoom information emailed with RSVP confirmation.
Immigration Equality shoulder bag for the first 100 registrants.

https://www.altheacenter.org/loveacrossborders
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Denver Police have killed again! And they won’t stop until we stop them! On Wednesday, Sept 9, they shot and killed...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Police have killed again! And they won’t stop until we stop them! On Wednesday, Sept 9, they shot and killed Antonio Blackbear, a 41-year-old Lakota man.

Antonio was the adopted cousin of another Lakota man killed by the Denver Police five years ago, Paul Castaway. Indigenous people are more likely than any other racial group to be killed by police.

There has been no semblance of justice for Paul in that time, since Denver District Attorneys, like their counterparts around the nation, refuse to hold police accountable for the violent, racist terror that forms the very core of their job description. We expect the fight for justice for Antonio to be a similarly difficult one.

The police have yet to release video of their killing of Antonio, nor say much about it, because they are working to craft a story that casts them in the best light.

Justice for Antonio Blackbear!
Defund, disarm, and disband the police!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver
